curriculum_stages.name: Basic Hit/Stand
curriculum_stages.description: Learn the fundamental strategy of hitting and standing. Agent should learn to stand on high totals and hit on low totals, understanding the basic probability of busting. Focus on learning when to take additional cards to maximize chances of winning without exceeding 21.

curriculum_stages.name: Hit/Stand with Dealer Awareness
curriculum_stages.description: The agent learns to adjust its hit/stand strategy based on the dealer's visible card. This introduces a higher level of strategic thinking as the agent needs to estimate the dealer's potential hand and adjust its actions accordingly. Requires learning the importance of the dealer's upcard in influencing the optimal decision.

curriculum_stages.name: Double Down Introduction
curriculum_stages.description: Introduce the 'Double Down' action. The agent needs to learn when doubling down is advantageous (e.g., strong starting hand like 11). It must balance the potential reward of doubling the bet against the risk of receiving a bad card and busting. Learning to identify favorable opportunities for doubling down.

curriculum_stages.name: Full Blackjack Strategy
curriculum_stages.description: The agent learns the full Blackjack strategy, including when to split pairs. Splitting requires understanding the probabilities associated with different card combinations and dealer upcards. This stage integrates all actions and requires complex decision-making based on the complete game state. Mastering the ability to strategically split pairs to maximize long-term earnings.
